title: Understanding the Reaction
text: When ammonia (NH3) reacts with hydrochloric acid (HCl), it forms ammonium chloride (NH4Cl). Think about how the ions are exchanged in this reaction.

title: Identify the Ions
text: Ammonia (NH3) acts as a base and accepts a proton (H+) from hydrochloric acid (HCl), which is a strong acid. This results in the formation of ammonium ion (NH4+) and chloride ion $$(Cl-)$$.

title: Write the Balanced Equation
text: Combine the ions to form the balanced chemical equation for the reaction between NH3 and HCl.
